questions.question: Everything .............................. she did was foolish.
questions.description: The relative pronoun that can refer to both people and things.

questions.question: Everybody ................................ there except James.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after everybody and everything.

questions.question: ................................. people have ever seen her laugh.
I haven't bought you ..................................
questions.description: We use any and anything in questions and negatives.

questions.question: I have hardly been .................................... since Easter.
questions.description: Hardly is a negative word. It is similar to not and hence it is used with anywhere.

questions.question: She sings better ................................. anybody I know.
questions.description: We use than after a comparative expression.

questions.question: ................................... surprisingly, he failed the test.
questions.description: To make a word, expression or clause negative, we use not.

questions.question: I phoned, but there was .................................... answer.
questions.description: Before a noun, no can mean 'not any'.

questions.question: I hate the thought .................................... you.
questions.description: Think is followed by of + ing form.

questions.question: It is difficult to understand ..................................... he says.
The main reason ....................................... I don't believe her is this.
questions.description: Reason is followed by why or that. Because is unusual.
